results.description:
We enjoy one another's company but it’s always great to have a couple friends to hang out with. We will be planning all types of events and activities, some with just a few couples and some with a big group so feel free to jump in wherever you feel comfortable. We’re open to any suggestions for fun meet-ups you might have in mind.

Let's get together for affordable activities in the Baltimore Metropolitan Area, like going to the comedy club, having picnics at the park, theater, movies, plays,  games, get togethers in our homes, local and international travel. We encourage you to recommend any ideas that you have. This group is designed for married couples or serious couples over 40 years of age.

When you join the group please be ready to commit to making your best effort to attend at least one meetup every few months. If you're already committed to a lot of other meetup groups this may not be the one for you--the goal is to have people get out to the meetups and get to know other couples.  Hope to see you at a meet-up soon!

Looking forward to meeting you,

Ruth and Gary 

Ken and Crystal
results.name: Baltimore Metro Couples Social Group

topics.name: Meeting old friends and making new friends

results.description: This group is for professionals in their 30s and up who are interested in a happy hour/dining/making new friends/meeting singles/networking. McGinty’s Public House has a friendly, relaxed atmosphere, daily happy hour and excellent dining. The expansive Upper Bar area can hold up to 400 people and I am able to reserve tables depending on how many people we have.
results.name: 30s & Up Professionals’ Social, Silver Spring

results.description: This is a group for anyone who loves to travel both with and without their family. If you want to start traveling but are overwhelmed by the process or don't have a companion, this group is for you. Think of it as a travel accountability group. If you always travel with your kids but want to do some mom or dad getaways with like-minded people, this group is for you. We'll meet to create our travel vision board and transform our dreams into goals and our goals into actions. We'll learn tips on how to travel for less so that we can travel more often. We are not going to be pitched by travel agents but rather work on designing the best vacations that work for us and our families' needs. Later down the line, we'll also plan group getaways, trips, and learn about destinations in fun and unique ways.
results.name: Baltimore-Washington-Annapolis Family Travel Club

results.description: We're a group of 80's music lovers. We get together every Friday night to mingle and dance to 80's dance tunes to include Depeche Mode, New Order, Talking Heads, The Cure, Siouxsie, Ministry, The Fixx, Human League and so many others! 1728 N. Charles St., Baltimore, MD 21201 Begins at 9p
results.name: Baltimore 80's Music Meetup

results.description:
We are a twelve year old book club of women 50+ and we are  adding new members as some of our group have moved out of the area and we are now only about 10.  Meetings are held monthly in the founders home in Kensington/Silver Spring, MD every 2nd Sunday of the month from 5:00-7:00+. Everyone brings a dish and we discuss that month's book over dinner. Our group is mostly divorced women 50+ with a shared love of not only the well written word, but the arts too (theater, galleries, good movies, music, PBS) and those interested do some  of those things together as well. Some of us are also artists or crafts women doing creative projects like knitting, quilting, crocheting, beading, jewelry making, painting, etc.). However, the important thing we all have in common is our appreciation of really good literature, well written books that inspire, and our yearly picks include no "fluff". So, this is a great group for serious readers (not that some of us don't read mysteries, suspense, non fiction, etc. on the side too). 
We look forward to knowing you, however, because we meet in the founders  home, she will contact you directly  and ask you to call her so you can talk a bit first. Warm Regards.
results.name: Silver Spring Women 50+ Book Club Meetup

topics.name: Family and Friends of Deployed Soldiers

This group is for young navy wives in Maryland who need a place to connect and be with those who also have a love for God. I am moving from San Diego to Maryland is 2 months. Let's connect now! Join the group and as soon as I get settled and find a house you are invited over for a first meeting date :) -Elyse (Ages 18-33)

I am starting this group because I am a passionate Italian-American woman who wants to share my fabulous heritage and modern-day connections to Italy and the local Italian community with others. Suggestions are always welcome. Welcome to La Famiglia!

results.description: Are you fed up with the policy gridlock, hyper-partisanship, name-calling, and ever widening political chasm in our culture? Are you longing for a better way to address society's pressing challenges? This discussion group is based on the idea that it can be possible to find common ground across the political spectrum if we can gain a better understanding of each others perspectives through face to face dialogue. People of all political stripes who are open-minded and curious are welcome. The objectives are to 1) bring together participants with diverse political views, 2) conduct a respectful and productive conversation about a difficult topic in a safe environment, and 3) explore possible areas of common ground. To promote these goals, discussions will be loosely structured around a format called “Living Room Conversations” (see http://www.livingroomconversations.org/), which has been successful in finding common ground between groups as politically disparate as the Tea Party and MoveOn.org. An inaugural meeting is planned for the evening of March 20. To join the conversation or find out more, contact Keith.Kozloff@verizon.net.
results.name: Conversations to Bridge the Political Divide

results.description:

In addition to hourly rentals, we offer a different style of photography workshops. Complete submersion into a creative environment without the formulas and (extended) technical detail. A true and complete learning experience that you will want to come back to over and over.

Join us today and ignite your creativity!

results.description: In this group we aim to reformulate and unify all knowledge, including ontological mathematics, cosmic evolution, the universal dialectic and ethics into a coherent framework. Since, by definition, existence cannot come from non-existence, an accurate understanding of reality itself requires the acceptance of an “Arche”, an eternal and fundamental basis of reality in a constant state of becoming. Aristotle postulated such reality as a conversion of potential into actuality in an all-encompassing process termed “Entelechy”. This perspective allows for a pivotal understanding of life, intelligence and the divine as evolutionary events occurring along a continuum. God is traditionally viewed as the pinnacle of intelligence, power, and complexity, but existence cannot begin with such qualities. Rather, the universe evolves in complexity over time: it was not created by God, but is God in potentia. Thus we can propose a unification of science and religion in which a creator God is a logical impossibility, but God as the end-product of cosmic evolution is logical. The Universe is converting infinite potential into maximum actualization; and we are participants in the entire process, which is perhaps the ultimate meaning of life.
results.name: Illuminism Institute

Robert Kelleman
rkelleman@yahoo.com

This is a group for people who want to spend more time in the glorious cemeteries in the Baltimore area. Depending on who wants to meet up---I can think of a million things we could do! We could take documentary pictures, arty pictures, look for particular people, delve into genealogy, read up on the history of cemeteries in Baltimore and cemeteries in general, read and talk about cultural attitudes toward death, (potentially) clean up neglected cemeteries, make friends and learn about the flora and fauna, geek out about sculptors and trends and symbols in mortuary sculpture, get in touch with our inner teenage goth(s), prowl around aimlessly, etc. There are such great cemeteries here, all full of great art and history and green space.

I promise I am not a weird person.

results.description:

Are you looking for added accountability in your wellness pursuits, and making new friends? Interested in taking a FREE week of classes to make some new friends? Then this group is for you! Pilates, Health and Dance (PHD) by Everlea is a small group and private training health and fitness studio for men and women interested in Mat and Equipment Pilates, Barre, Personal training, and more! We offer regular classes and personal training sessions as well as hosting FREE events (like workouts, seminars and healthy potlucks) for our Meetup friends to mix and mingle!

About Our Studio:  In addition to training the general population, we specialize in wellness and training for pre and post-natal moms, seniors, and clients rehabilitating from injuries. Owner, Everlea Bryant McGrath, is a trainer and professional dancer and also a new mom of multiples! She knows, through challenging personal experiences, that health and wellness doesn't come easy, but the results are well worth the effort! <br>

results.description: This group is for beginning investors looking for simple actionable direction to get started from scratch in real estate investing. If you've bought enough courses, watched enough webinars, and wasted enough money on programs, come plug into this group designed by active investors to help you get started closing deals. Our goal is to create a friendly environment of learning, partnering and sharing. We want to be a resource to answer your questions and and help you destroy the roadblocks that have been hindering your success. WE'VE BUILT THIS GROUP FOR PEOPLE WHO ASK THEMSELVES QUESTIONS LIKE: - - How do I start making money in real estate without my own cash, credit, or experience? - How do I start effectively marketing without a huge budget? - Where do I locate the best deals in my area? - What are the best ways to protect myself and stay out of legal trouble when doing deals? - How do I evaluate properties to know whether I've found a deal? If your ready to take action and build your Prince George's County/Washington DC real estate investing business, come join us at our next meetup group session.
results.name: Getting Started in Real Estate Investing PG/DC chapter

results.description:
This is a group for people interested in meeting up with others to learn and play board games of all types.  Here at The Board and Brew, we've got 600+ games and a full menu with a complete line of espresso drinks, a variety of craft beers, sandwiches, salads and sides, with breakfast served all day.

Meet up with other people interested in learning games and finding groups to play with.

Join us Monday nights for $1 game night.  Order $10 of food/drink, and play unlimited games for just $1.  We've also got one of our game gurus on staff Monday nights.  Our gurus can recommend games, and even teach you how to play some of them.  They're experts at fitting people with just the right game no matter what interests they may have.  No matter what your tastes, chances are our guru can make sure you're having a good time.
results.name: Board and Brew Gamers: join others for food drink and games

results.description:
Spiritual journey a little rocky? Or smooth as a walk along the beach? Either way, walking through life is easier and more interesting with others than alone. We are Spiritual Seekers of Ellicott City, and we would love for you to join our meetup. Everyone is welcome. Here are some things we do:

 ~ Quest Discussion Forum is a safe place to discuss life’s questions, such as inner peace and personal views of reality. Engage in robust conversation, or simply bring your spirit and listen. Open to anyone 18 and older.

~ Mysteries is an open environment to discuss life’s mysteries: space, the quantum world, consciousness, intuition, dreams, free will vs determinism or life’s other big unknowns. Open to anyone 18 and older.

~ Pathways is a forum for contemporary spiritual ideas based on one of today’s spiritual leaders. Share in meaningful conversation and meditation. Open to anyone 18 and older.

 ~ In Drum Circle, we share the fun of drumming. Open to all ages. Sound like you? Sign up for whatever sounds appealing and check us out. No membership or event fee.

                                                           ___________________________

Events are held at Channing Memorial Unitarian Universalist Church.  Channing is a small, lively, welcoming UU congregation in the Ellicott City area. Our mission is to: invite seekers into spiritual community, connect souls in mystery and wonder, and ignite compassion into action.
results.name: Spiritual Seekers of Ellicott City

results.description:
This group is for new-in-towners, young professionals, and single people who are seeking to connect and grow through the basic principles of courtship while experiencing the wide variety of entertainment the DMV has to offer. Membership is FREE, and you only have to be friendly and fun to join!

We have a happy hour each month where we raise money for various local charities (all voluntary donations).

We will meet at least twice a month for an outing, whether for our own private dinner, speed dating, happy hours, discussions, dancing, exercising, movie nights, or church’s events. Feel free to contact me with suggestions for events you are interested in doing.

Our Objectives are to

Have fun while living life to the fullest

Meet other people who enjoy going out and having fun with other wonderful people

Learn how to be the best version of ourselves we can be

Experience and enjoy all that the DMV has to offer 

Bond with and enjoy the company of others

Empower each other with the knowledge to start and build a healthy relationship  

Meet other single people who are serious about being in a committed relationship                               

Opportunity to meet your mate

Build a solid relationship with someone where they are a friend as well as a companion


If these are your some of your objectives, we welcome you.
results.name: Court Me not Date Me

This forum also aims to serve as the hub for training and business development news that benefit veterans working in the technology, particularly the cybersecurity, industry in Maryland. For more information, please visit http://www.cic-tech.org/programs-services/techvets . You can also follow us on  the CIC's Facebook, LinkedIn andTwitter pages (#MDTechVets).

results.description: This is a group for musicians, their families, and friends who can get together and enjoy some great music. This group is focused toward traditional acoustic musicians who enjoy playing and learning together. All are welcome to attend even if you are just there to listen and enjoy the time with friends and family. We ask that the musicians at the jam abide by a few rules. We will only allow Traditional bluegrass instruments - Acoustic 6 String Guitar, Mandolin, Fiddle, Dobro, Upright Bass, and 5 String Banjo. Harmonicas are okay too if you can really play it! Also, acoustic bass is okay if you can't bring the upright. While all are welcome at this jam we will be playing some intermediate to advanced bluegrass. Don't let this scare you away! We are more than willing to slow it down too. This is a chance to have fun and pick together as a community, this is not a contest to see who the fastest flat picker is. This jam is set in a family environment so we ask that you please respect this and conduct yourself appropriately. The final say in what will and won't be allowed at the jam lies with the organizer. We look forward to seeing you!
results.name: Central Maryland Bluegrass Jam

results.description:
SHIFTandGO Ride Events is an independent open-invite motorcycle group for riders who want to ride more than anything else.  Based out of Maryland, we are Riders and RideSeekers who create, organize and lead to inspire others to do more, see more, get more out of their riding experience.  Our mission is to provide the best street motorcycle riding experience, outside of racing.  We offers new and exciting monthly group riding options throughout the country for those who prefer twisty back roads and unique destinations to collect both miles and memories.  Each riding season, from April to October, we provide over 20 different half-day and full-day scheduled meet-up rides and up to six (6) city tour events to satisfy all types of riding and riding experiences.   

http://www.youtube.com/embed/KUj5wiSowDE

SHIFTandGO Ride Events doesn't compete or replace Club, Group, Team or Solo Riding-Life, it adds to it with new ride options, open to all.  Riders choose the type of ride you want to experience, RSVP + guest(s), and allow us to lead the way.  For more information about SHIFTandGO, the RIDESEEKERS TOUR, or upcoming scheduled rides in your area, visit www.SHIFTandGO.com, Like us on Facebook, and see our schedule on www.Meetup.com/SHIFTandGO.  

https://youtu.be/ZIgpS2fLUs0

Want more SHIFTandGO?  Subscribe to us on YouTube.   Stay Up, Stay Out There and Thank You...CLUTCH aka Clutch-Time.

results.description:
My goals for the group are to help you create portraits where the subject(s) look terrific with great lighting and posing. I will concentrate on those two areas. The kind of camera you have will not matter. I believe you can create a great portrait with the best camera around or a cell phone. 

You should  know how to work your camera. There are many other factors such as backgrounds, clothing and the message you want to convey that go into creating a portrait. Those will all be addressed as needed or in a separate class. The classes are for people who want to improve their people portraits. Anyone can pick up a camera these days and take a photo but to take a portrait to the next level requires more thought, understanding and a lot of practice.  

I'd like to see how the group evolves, but for now we'll get together on location, near Silver Spring, Bethesda and NW and learn about natural portrait posing and lighting. Sometimes we will go for an urban look and other times we might go to a park. We will look for lighting situations that mimic studio lighting without lighting equipment (except maybe a reflector). We will pose each other as singles, couples and groups and occasionally we'll have a model. Next fall I may teach studio portraits. Most of the time we'll meet on Saturday morning and be done before noon.

I look forward to sharing with you. Barbara Glaeser
results.name: Washington Portrait Posing & Lighting Meetup

results.description: Monthly gatherings for beginner ukulele classes (12 ukes are provided, or BYOU), intermediate classes, and ukulele jams. Leaders will be ever changing, as will the location! results.description: Are you interested in learning more about Qigong energy healing? This group is for promoting health and wellness through an ancient practice called QiGong. What is Qigong? Qigong focuses on improving physical health and wellness. It opens the energy flow within the body by eliminating blockages. The intent is to balance the body by opening the energetic pathways (meridians). This is accomplished by a series of gentle movements synchronized with the breath. This form of Qigong can be safely practiced by the beginner, with limited movement, to the most advanced student. It benefits all students and aides them in moving forward no matter what their prior experiences. Each class is started with a set of Opening Moves to allow the body structure to open in all directions. Next, we move through the Qigong movements. These movements focus on Energy passing through specific pathways (or meridians). The class ends with a closing Qigong form that integrates the mind-body-spirit to a more grounded state of well-being. Qigong is an excellent tool to acquire mind-body-spirit awareness. Its movements provide a path toward personal transformation. Each individual may have a different experience each time they practice the form. The goal is as they work toward balance of the Yin-Yang Qi they will notice improved health, increased energy and a greater awareness of life. What are the benefits? Qigong enhances immune function, reduces the ill effects of stress, prevents disease, calms the mind and emotions, lowers blood pressure, increases flexibility, cultivates energy, treats chronic pain, and improves sleep.
results.name: Laurel Qigong Meetup

results.description:
Veterans Forever Soldiers (VFS) is a 501(c)(3) tax-exempt nonprofit organization with a mission to Honor, Respect, and Care for United States Military Veterans. We have created this wholistic-focused veterans interest group to build a support network of veterans and veteran spouses who are passionate, motivated and energized to mastermind and act in loving support to veterans. This is a space for those who are ready to make a serious impact in, thereby changing, the way service is delivered in the veteran community. Veterans - our very own families and friends - are grieving, homeless, hungry, traumatized. Together we will wholistically 1) mastermind/have open table-top discussions on the issues so that we can create/develop activities such as workshops, food programs, presenting at various venues, fund raise, item raise, item distribution, outdoor sport and other events;  and 2) act - implement and carry forward these activities.

VETers may be interested in helping to strengthen the organization by joining the Board of Directors, Advisory Board or other committee. Any funds raised are tax deductible to the donor and 100% benefit to VFS. VETers will meet once per month for starters. Let's get together in continuation of service.

Visit our website here http://veteransforeversoldiers.org/
results.name: Hyattsville 'VetsUp' Veterans Support Meetup

This group is a "clone group" of our main meetup page which is simply called "The Firefly House". The purpose of this is to draw membership from the Maryland area, as we sometimes have events there as well as in DC.

____________________________
We are a tradition of Witchcraft based in the DC/NOVA/MD area. Our meetup is the container for what we call the "outer circle" of participants and members. We are facilitated by a governing coven called Coven of the Spiral Moon, the "inner circle." We put on public rituals for many of the sabbats as well as a number of classes on various Wiccan and Witchcraft-related topics. We are also a Wiccan tradition that people can participate in casually, or through the deeper path of initiation into the outer circle or one of our two coven's. All respectful individuals are welcome to engage in this Great Work of evolving our souls, growing in power, and becoming attuned with this holy Earth.

results.description:
A drum circle is a fun experience that is accessible to anyone who wants to participate regardless of age or experience level. The goal is to achieve oneness with a group, not rhythmic perfection. Shamanism is the oldest spiritual belief system on earth. Drumming has been a method of group healing and achieving unity since the beginning of time. Studies have shown that drumming accelerates physical healing, boosts the immune system and produces feelings of well-being.

The drum circle will be held every 2nd Saturday of the month from 7:00 to 8:30 with time for socializing afterwards.

results.description:
Welcome! In Susan's Kitchen you will find vegetarian cooking classes. Breathe Ayurveda offers consultations and classes. Meditation on Main is our weekly meditation group! All things to nourish your body, mind and soul. 

Meditation on Main Street with Susan Weis-Bohlen 7 pm - 8:15 pm, every Thursday night! * Tuesday, May 19 Meditation returns to Hampen! See details below CLASS MEETS AT 362 MAIN STREET IN REISTERSTOWN, MD 21136 AT THE CENTER FOR SPIRITUAL LIVING. Thursdays: Join us for a short Dharma talk, meditation instruction, breath-work, and 30-minutes sitting meditation. To these classes Susan brings her years of experience with many different types of meditation including Vedic, Vipassana, Jewish and Buddhist studies. This light-hearted group is a perfect sangha (community) for those seeking a place to meditate and meet others along the path. All levels of meditators are welcome! Susan has been meditating for over 20 years and has been teaching for nearly seven years. Many people have been able to create a regular meditation practice by anchoring their week with this group meditation. The benefits of meditation include reducing stress, anxiety, and drama in your life, sleeping better, the ability to manifest desires more easily and to learn that true happiness comes from within! Wear comfortable clothing. Chairs and meditation cushions provided. You don't need to bring anything but yourself. If you can breathe, you can meditate! "We don't undertake meditation to become better meditators. We meditate to have a better life." Cost: $10 donation suggested. * Susan will lead meditation again in Hampden on the THIRD TUESDAY of the month. The first class will be on May 19, 6 pm - 7:15 pm) at 2050 Rockrose Avenue - the north end of the building;in the Itineris Building. Suggested donation is $10.
results.name: Breathe Ayurveda & Susan's Kitchen and Meditation on Main

results.description: This is the group of Apache NiFi users in the MD, DC, VA area. Apache NiFi is an easy to use, powerful, and reliable system to process and distribute data.  In late 2014 it was open sourced to the Apache Software Foundation and it graduated to a top level project in July 2015.  This meetup provides an opportunity to discuss Apache NiFi, where it is at, where it is going, and to help grow the community of both users and developers interested in the technology and problem domain.

results.description:
AAEW is a professional non-profit organization focused on empowering women to reach their fullest potential.  We do not just focus on professional development, AAEW believes that success lies in a thriving personal and professional life.  Through professional development, resources, personal support and collaboration, we empower women to confidently achieve their dreams and become leaders in their communities. 

We provide invaluable resources, guidance, accessible tools, and empowerment that will take women to the next level in their personal and professional lives.

Inspire : We bring together a high caliber of women who desire to share their knowledge, experience and support. to promote personal growth and positive connections.  Our goal is to inspire those who have a strong desire to move to the next level in their lives.

Growth: Through relationship building, collaboration and sharing, we promote growth and challenge that will build confidence and success.

Connections: We strive to bring together a strong force of women with big hearts, open minds and similarity so that an unbreakable link can be established.

American Association of Empowered Women, Inc.

www.aaoew.org

 

JOIN TODAY!

results.description: The 2015 Capital Fitness Festival will be held on Saturday, June 20th on the National Mall, right next to the Washington Monument and we hope that you will be able to join us to help promote a healthier lifestyle through sport and proper nutrition. Capital Fitness Festival is the first largest outdoor event of its kind held in the Nation’s Capital. The festival is a one-day event encompassing the three main areas of fitness – sport, health and wellness. We are bringing together the top fitness instructors in the DMV area, as well as the top nutritionists and businesses from within this industry to present their newest products and services. It will be a full day of workshops, demos, presentations and family fun oriented activities. Another difference that sets us apart from everyone else is that we will have a separate area for kids’ fitness activities.
results.name: Capital Fitness Festival

results.description: This group is for anyone interested in creating an intentional sustainable homestead.  Its for people who value a healthy lifestyle, peace, low stress, harmony.  We can all work together cooperatively towards creating our homestead by growing food; including fruit trees, greens and other vegetables, herbs, berries, grapes, etc...  We can learn to live harmoniously together by implementing NVC (Non Violent Communication) and other effective and beneficial tools for communicating and relating in a healthy respectful way.  We can build our Eco structures on the land so there's no mortgage.  We can use compost toilets.  We can work from home to make incomes and live close to nature.  We can raise our children together so there's less overwhelm.  I started this meeting because I'm looking for other people to do this with .. To create community,, to support actualizing our ideas and visions
results.name: Sustainable Community Building

We just like to get together and have fun.
results.name: The MargaReaders

results.description: Muddy Waters is pleased to host the first (SHOCKER) Capital City Frienchie Meetup. All Pig Puppies, Bat Dogs, Bunny Pups, Smushed Face Friends, Fur Babies, Frenchie Fans and their human +1's are welcome. We plan to pawtay in different DC Metro area dog parks each Friday. Two mandatory elements of each Meetup include: having fun and being fabulous; sound do'able? Come thru.
results.name: Classy Canine Club Presents Frenchie Friday's

results.description: Currach racing on the Chesapeake Bay!  The Annapolis Irish Rowing Club is dedicated to promoting the nautical heritage of Ireland and the traditional Irish fishing and work boat, the currach.  We are a competivive rowing team, racing against other currach teams in the Northeast of the USA.  We are targeting athletic individuals who have a strong desire to compete and who are willing to make a commitment to practices and regattas. Irish currach rowing is a different technique and takes some practice to get the hang of it.  The Annapolis Irish Rowing Club is not crew-style rowing or Dragon-boat style rowing.  Our currachs are located on Spa Creek in beautiful downtown Annapolis.
results.name: Annapolis Irish Rowing Club (AIRC)

results.description:
NOTE:

• There is no charge to join this group.

• This group is not for travel agents.

• There will be no promoting services.

• Please contact admin for that,

• This group is based in MD/DMV area but we accept from all areas.

thank you


This group is for women who are solo travelers ages 30 & over but hate traveling alone, sometimes.

We will indulge in weekend getaways, and traveling across the world-inexpensively, of course. We will only promote positivity.

Not only will we share the common goal of getting our passports stamped to capacity but we will also explore the opportunities to bond, make new friends, and network. Everyone is encouraged to give ideas for vacations, and events. all travel arrangements will be handled by group admin.

All members must

• attend a meet & greet within 3 months of joining

• have a photo in your profile.

•  be open minded, and ready to have fun


Please, no promoting services. Please always feel free to contact me via email with questions and concerns.

Cattiness, drama and ugly attitudes are not acceptable.
results.name: Divas with Passports

results.description:
Want to see great documentary films . . . followed by discussion . . . free of charge . . . every month? We believe this is the only documentary film series in Baltimore that is open to the public and free of charge. (We appreciate and encourage donations, but they're optional). 

We purchased a license from the Motion Picture Licensing Corporation.

Always on the fourth Wednesday of the month at 6:30 pm in downtown Baltimore. You can see the upcoming films here: http://http://baltimoreethicalsociety.org/programs-activities/film-series/

The current batch of upcoming films are all all academy award nominees - or winners.  After the viewing, we'll have a discussion, usually with a local expert or advocate on the particular topic to lead the discussion.

The series is hosted by the Baltimore Ethical Society in a beautiful viewing space, with free street parking.  Refreshments (beverages and snacks) are free, and other food is available for purchase. We'll take food orders (delivery pizza, etc?).  We can eat while we watch.  So bring a couple of bucks in case you get hungry.

We'll also use this site to announce a separate discussion series, without films, on Sunday mornings at 10:30 am in the same location. Also with food, and also free of charge.   These are presentations by local experts or advocates on a topicial issue, followed by Q & A.  These Sunday presentations are preceded by an introduction and brief announcements by the Baltimore Ethical Society, and followed by Q & A, then time to mingle, to enjoy snacks, and to speak with the presenter.
results.name: Charm City Film Series

results.description: "Toddlerz N Tweenz and all ages N between is a community of parents and children who gather for social outings across the DMV. The target age group is 2-12 yrs. and the fun is limitless. Some of our activities will consists of skating, movies debut, theme parties, and so much more"These outings and events are thoughtfully designed to foster relationships while having fun. Relationships that will last a life time.
results.name: Toddlerz N Tweenz

results.description: This is a group for anyone who is interested in investing in real estate in Maryland. We invite new and experienced investors. I started this group because I have been a real estate broker who specializes in Bank owned properties and have dealt with many investors over the last 32 years. I am a very experienced real estate broker and investor. I am looking for others to join our meetup so they can find the best investment properties in the market. These properties might be currently on the market or properties that no one else knows about. I look forward to sharing my experience with everyone.
results.name: Baltimore Real Estate Investors Meetup

results.description:
We are a group of Christian men and women who believe they have an end-time calling, and who are committed to being equipped, edified and empowered to fulfill it.  We are excited about walking in identity and authority as Ambassadors for Christ, preparing the Way of the Lord!  Christ is coming back for His Church - a Church without spot or wrinkle.  Therefore, The Bride must make Herself ready!  We have work to do!  The Kingdom of Heaven is at hand.  The harvest is plentiful, but the laborers are few!  It's time to prepare the way of the Lord!

Who Should Join?  Men and women in ministry who ready to respond to the call of God on their lives. These are leaders in any capacity:  Sunday school teachers, ministry leaders, aspiring leaders, teachers, evangelists, altar workers, worship leaders, etc.  We are also giving special focus to those who serve full or part-time on staff at a Church or faith-based organization.  

Why Should You Join?

https://youtu.be/L8NX_ovuJVc


                      Our Mission is to raise up 1,000,000 Way Makers all over the world!  


Our study and discussion centers on the book entitled "The Way Makers - Ambassadors for Christ, Preparing the Way of the Lord" by Min. Angela M. Gracey, PHR. We meet bi-weekly on Saturdays from 10:00am to 12 noon, starting June 6, 2015, at the new Panera Bread, 14806 Baltimore Avenue in Laurel, MD. We are also committed to empowering, equipping and coaching aspiring authors to develop their creative gift and to give birth to the vision within them.   

This is what one of our pioneer leaders had to say:

https://youtu.be/0VrCrlmoZu4

We encourage all prospective members to come prepared to fully participate and commit to the process of growth and development as a Christian leader. If you are serious about the call of God on your life, we want to extend a warm invitation to join us! Jesus is coming back for a Church without spot or wrinkle. The harvest is plentiful, but the laborers are few! It's time to repent! The Kingdom of Heaven is at hand. We are The Way Makers - Ambassadors for Christ! Preparing the Way of the Lord!
results.name: The Way Makers Book Club Meetup

results.description:
REAL WORLD LOCAL CONTENT TO HELP YOU GROW AS A REAL ESTATE INVESTOR IN VA, DC, & MD!

Over 1500 DC Metro Real Estate Investors and growing! Go to www.cazainvestornetwork.com to get access to our past meetups + training.

Monthly Format:

1) Introduction: 15 minutes
2) Training Q&A: 50 minutes
3) Deals/Networking/Fun: 30 minutes

Welcome to the largest real estate investment network in the DC Metro area. Each month we discuss a topic at length which will help you grow as a real estate investor.

Jan: Getting Started: Why Wholesaling Is Your Foundation & How To Do It Effectively

Feb: How To Market For Deals

Mar: How To Estimate Renovations

April: How To Negotiate The Deal

May: Where To Find The Money

June: Rehabbing For Big Profit!

July: Building Your Investment Dream Team

Aug: Cash Flow - Buy and Hold: The Key to Wealth

Sept: How To Manage Properties Effectively

Oct: Lease Options/Subject To:

Nov: Building Your Investor Partner/Private Money Team/Be the Bank

Dec: HOLIDAY PARTY - CAZA MVP Award

I look forward to seeing you all there, let's make it a great year!

PS: Go to www.cazainvestornetwork.com to get access to our past meetups & more training.

Join the #1 Real Estate Investment Group in Virginia, DC and Maryland.

We can also explore activities (i.e. dance, kickboxing, Tae Kwon Do, cycling, tennis, painting class, etc.) - anything that looks like fun! This group is for real women looking to establish authentic friendships. We'll share adventures, have fun together, learn from each other and help one another as we aspire to become better versions of ourselves - all while creating lifelong friendships.

topics.name: Quilting for Beginners and Experianced Persons
Sewing for the Love of it
Machine or hand piecing and quilting

results.description:
Hi There!

We are a group of lively, fun, friendly, kind and talented people. Please join us!

We have exciting news!  Being a member of Goodstitches, YOU are now part of a HUGE network of needle artist spanning the GLOBE!

Goodstitches.com

What does that mean? 

In early February we started working on Goodstitches. We have opened up 270+ Meetup groups in 7 countries!  We have Meetups in the USA, Canada, Australia, England, Wales, Ireland and Scotland!  Needle artists from all over the globe have joined Goodstitches before we have even had our FIRST event!  That is what we were hoping for!

We know that YOU want ACTIVE groups in your local area.  We know that you want to meet people in your area for friendship and to work and learn together.  We are making that possible!

Want to be a local host of your group or an event organizer of your local group?  WE want you!  Leaders of local groups are needed and we are providing ALL the tools-videos, pictures, forms and online training to help you make your local group successful!

Goodstitches.com

What is the purpose of Goodstitches? It is a way that people in the quilting, sewing and needle art community can connect. By being a part of this group, you are going to be able to find others and share knowledge, ask questions, find supplies, post your pictures on the meetup site and much more!

You will also be able to sell your used quilting machine, sewing machine, parts of your stash or tools that you no longer need. 

You will be able find or post a job in the needle arts!  If you are an employer, you will be able to reach needle artists in your area to fill an open job.  If you are a member looking for a job, you will be able to shop open jobs or post your resume.  ONLY people of the needle arts industry will be participating so you will be able to target your search more directly. 

You will also be able to post your business on THE STITCHERS BIZ!  No matter what area of the needle arts you work in, now you will be able to post WITH pictures and videos!  People will find a way to check YOUR postings Facebook, Pinterest, Tumbler and such!  They will also have a DIRECT way to contact you to hire you to do your work. 

If you are a manufacturer or business, you will be able to put your work out for bid or find someone who can finish a difficult project that you are unable to complete. 

Goodstitches will be working with sponsors that you know and getting good deals for you, the members of Goodstitches. Be it batting, thread, rulers, needles, yarn and embroidery threads...anything that you need to work on your craft, we are doing deals with the manufactures so that we can pass on the GREAT deals to YOU the members of Goodstitches.

We look forward to meeting you in person and getting to know you!

The Goodstitches Team

For any questions, comments, ideas, advertising, or opening a group near you please contact:

Fena D'Ottavio  FenaBiz@gmail.com

Connect With Us! 

Facebook

Twitter

Tumblr

Instagram

Youtube

Pinterest

results.description: Monday nights from 8:00-9:30 we will have a pick-up basketball game at the Odenton Sports Center. Our goal is to get is 15 RSVPs! this will allow to have 3 teams (2 on the court an the other one resting), after the game is over the losing team goes to rest unless the winning team has won 2 consecutive games, in which case they go to rest. This will keep a good rotation. Invite a friend/guest and have them join the group if possible. All skill levels are welcome. Note: We will continue the event if we get 10 RSVPs. results.description: Hello. I'm starting this meetup group to exchange philosophy and ideas that will facilitate unity of all races and beliefs. Ultimately this group is for anyone interested in learning proven strategies for improving their relationships, whether they be business/professional or personal/romantic. I encourage anyone interested to remember this group is about sharing ideas, not forcing them. Please come to these meetings with an open ear. Sharing the opportunity to speak and listen with others, will allow you the chance to learn from their experiences.
results.name: Non-violent Communication and Empathy

results.description:
"Behind every successful woman should be a tribe of women who have her back."
Hello lovely ladies. Are you a single black woman, that has realized that everyone around you has kids and/or married and you feel left out? You often find yourself the only one at events with no kids and husband, maybe a boyfriend. It's fun chilling and spending time with our boyfriends, but every woman needs good girlfriends too. Men don't always want to do what we want to do. Do you often find yourself not having many girlfriends or female relatives to hang out with any more because they have relocated, gotten married, have mommy duties or have a certain time to be home. Do you sometimes find yourself sitting at home on a beautiful sunny day with no girlfriends to chill with. Or on a weekend night watching Lifetime, LMN or Bravo? Do you just want to be spontaneous sometimes and just call and say let's go out or do something fun? This group is for heterosexual, Christian,  professional, classy, intelligent, positive and drama-free and like-minded women that are seeking to socialize and build true lasting friendships that will develop into a sisterhood. This will be a small group to foster a close knit and engaging atmosphere. The group will consist of women that are supportive, encouraging, inspirational and uplifting to one another. Let's engage in some awesome activities, while developing bonds and making memories that will last a lifetime. Some of the activities include: dining, brunch, lounges, cruises, festivals, concerts, plays, broadway musicals, live bands, weekend getaways, movies, spas, picnics and day trips. Having children or getting married doesn't define you, they enhance your life. We never know what God has in store for us. Until then, let's live our lives and enjoy us until we do get married and become moms. If you are interested in meeting other wonderful, like-minded ladies to explore the DMV and so much more, please join this group. I understand that sometimes you won't be able to attend every outing, but please be an active participant to make this group a success. This is not just a meetup but friendship group. Constant no shows will lead to the member being deleted from the group. Currently this group is closed to new members.
results.name: Laurel Sisterhood Meetup Ages 30-40 (Single/Without Kids)

results.description:
We are a social running group that welcomes people of all paces. 

While Baltimore is known for its rats that scurry underneath, we scurry over Roads And Trails --we are the Baltimore RAT Runners. It seems many of our runners are new to town, so if "B'more" and "Hon" are new to you, you should feel right at home with us.

Our Monday runs start at 6:45 p.m. next to the Under Armour store on S. President St. (we are not associated with UA). We have options for 3-6 miles depending on your level. 

Here are some of our runs: 
Patterson Park:http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/911470207  
Four Mile Out and Back through Fells Point: 
http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/911459085 
Lake Roland Park: 
http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/911501951 
Inner Harbor: 
http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/911510093 
Federal Hill: 
http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/911534733

Also, if you drive and find parking difficult, try the 1200 block of Bank Street for free street parking.  Also, the Little Italy Garage is inexpensive and safe.  It's between Central, Exeter, and Bank streets. 

Whether you live in Baltimore or are visiting, feel free to join us. 

Dan
results.name: Baltimore RAT Runners

This group is for those who are interested in accelerated spiritual advancement and deeper understanding of how we can release or overcome boundaries we have placed on ourselves. Through the use of healing energy we can raise our vibration and improve our quality of health, wealth and happiness.

I AM a Reiki Master and Holistic Practitioner, Consultant and Facilitator who provides multiple forms/modalities of energetic healing including Usui, Tibetan and Kundalini Reiki, Pranic Healing, Shamanism, Crystal therapy, Sound therapy, Violet Flame, Tantra, meditation/mindfulness and Chakra/Aura clearing and balancing. I integrate all my modalities into a healing session if requested and incorporate spiritual life coaching.

This is a meetup group that is focus on informing and supporting its community members on variety of sensitive  topics relating to Maryland Medical Marijuana Commission's regulatory updates and mandates as it pertains to the new Department of Health and Mental Hygiene's  initiative. 

Green Pro partners and Wellness, along with its team of meetup organizers plan to facilitate and engage this group with series of monthly community Meetups and Webinar events  in downtown Civic Center as well as other strategic business locations within the community, along with special guest and subject matter experts on specific topics.     

• May 2015 event is for those interested in "The Medicinal Marijuana Business in      Maryland." There will be an expert panel and business organizations on hand to answer questions and a chance to make connections vital to a successful business.  Follow this link to RSVP  for this event. 

• June 2015 event is for those members interested in "Networking event." Guest will include potential growers, dispensary owners, strain specialist, and industry equipment suppliers. Exact date and time to be announced.

• July 2015 event is for those interested in knowing “Different ways to administer.” Guest and topics will include Edible vendors, “Cannabis pairing advice”, uses of oils, vapor, and topical's. Exact date and time to be announced.

• August 2015 event is for those interested in "Understanding the application process." Special guest (TBA)
results.name: Silver Spring Medical Marijuana Community Meetup Group.

results.description:
This group is where small businesses come to ask questions about Technology and Cyber Security. We will meet once a month in Downtown Baltimore. With the correct information, small businesses can be empowered to make informed decisions. All consulting performed in this group is 100% free! Get the answers you need to make the right decisions for your business.

All of our groups will meet monthly in the community supporting local businesses. It is our goal to bring knowledge to communities and help them define the future of their small businesses using unbiased information.

If you own or are affiliated with a small business we invite you to bring your questions and concerns about technology and Internet/cyber security to our meet ups and let's discuss them together. Blue skies and Warm waters

results.description:
The meetup group is Tom Thumb Square Dance Club and it is for those who want to socialize and exercise at the same time, make new friends and just have fun!!!!! There is a slogan we dancers use: While dancing in a square you make a circle of friends! Dancers must be at least 18 years of age, couples, singles and families are welcome to attend square dance lessons hosted by the club and children are allowed if accompanied by an adult.  Lessons usually start in early September (14th of September) and are held at the Catonsville Senior Center. Beginner dances are held every 6-8 weeks during the time a new dancers is learning to dance. For information call 301-919-2525 or e-mail your request to roslyn.powers@gmail.com. Square Dancing is lead by a caller and all in the square work together to dance to the caller's choreography. Square dancing is a team sport and once you learn the calls you can dance anywhere, USP, Europe, China, et cetera. Square Dance Calls are a universal language.


The club dances every first and third Friday of the month. We dance at the Hollifield Station Elementary  School in Ellicott City, MD.


Come watch us dance!!  We will be hosting a square dance demo at the Howard County Fair. Demo is at 5pm at the Entertainment Stage on Saturday, August 8th and a beginner's dance is at 7pm in the 4H Activities Hall.
results.name: Tom Thumb Square Dance Club- Ellicott City, MD

topics.name: Quality of Life for the Elderly

results.description:
If you have ANY health issues and want to see if you can get better naturally, check this out!

Back/neck pain?  Knee/hip pain?  Digestive problems?  Weak muscle tone?  Scoliosis?   

Our physical body can maintain, regenerate and heal itself. Proper walking awakens the body’s natural healing functions so it can operate with optimal efficiency and greater synergy. 

Whereas eating properly not only fills us up, but also nourishes our body with essential vitamins and nutrients, walking not only gets us from point A to point B, it also naturally and properly helps to adjust our muscles, spine, bones and joints, and energy pathways. 

Proper natural walking also helps our emotional health, mind, and spiritual heart.

Natural-Walking is easy and gentle.  

Once you learn how to walk by this method, continuing to walk 30 minutes a day usually results in improvements in various health issues.
results.name: Secrets of Natural Walking in Columbia, MD

results.description:
Hi There!

We are a group of lively, fun, friendly, kind and talented people. Please join us!

We have exciting news!  Being a member of Goodstitches, YOU are now part of a HUGE network of needle artist spanning the GLOBE!

Goodstitches.com 

What does that mean? 

In early February we started working on Goodstitches. We have opened up 270+ Meetup groups in 7 countries!  We have Meetups in the USA, Canada, Australia, England, Wales, Ireland and Scotland!  Needle artists from all over the globe have joined Goodstitches before we have even had our FIRST event!  That is what we were hoping for!

We know that YOU want ACTIVE groups in your local area.  We know that you want to meet people in your area for friendship and to work and learn together.  We are making that possible!

Want to be a local host of your group or an event organizer of your local group?  WE want you!  Leaders of local groups are needed and we are providing ALL the tools-videos, pictures, forms and online training to help you make your local group successful!

Goodstitches.com 

What is the purpose of Goodstitches? It is a way that people in the quilting, sewing and needle art community can connect. By being a part of this group, you are going to be able to find others and share knowledge, ask questions, find supplies, post your pictures on the meetup site and much more!

You will also be able to sell your used quilting machine, sewing machine, parts of your stash or tools that you no longer need. 

You will be able find or post a job in the needle arts!  If you are an employer, you will be able to reach needle artists in your area to fill an open job.  If you are a member looking for a job, you will be able to shop open jobs or post your resume.  ONLY people of the needle arts industry will be participating so you will be able to target your search more directly. 

You will also be able to post your business on THE STITCHERS BIZ!  No matter what area of the needle arts you work in, now you will be able to post WITH pictures and videos!  People will find a way to check YOUR postings Facebook, Pinterest, Tumbler and such!  They will also have a DIRECT way to contact you to hire you to do your work. 

If you are a manufacturer or business, you will be able to put your work out for bid or find someone who can finish a difficult project that you are unable to complete. 

Goodstitches will be working with sponsors that you know and getting good deals for you, the members of Goodstitches. Be it batting, thread, rulers, needles, yarn and embroidery threads...anything that you need to work on your craft, we are doing deals with the manufactures so that we can pass on the GREAT deals to YOU the members of Goodstitches.

We look forward to meeting you in person and getting to know you!

The Goodstitches Team

For any questions, comments, ideas, advertising, or opening a group near you please contact:

Fena D'Ottavio  FenaBiz@gmail.com

Connect With Us! 

Facebook 

Twitter 

Tumblr 

Instagram 

Youtube 

Pinterest

We provide women Nationwide the perfect opportunity to experience the world with supportive, like-minded women who have been bitten by the travel bug. 

We are real women, serious about travel. YOU should be too.

We don't collect Meetup groups. We collect Friendships....Memories....Passport Stamps!

If you are a "Down to Earth", Independent Traveler able to go with the flow, enjoys Culture, Food, Wine (Spirits), Nature and Music, then you'll fit in just fine.

*If you are a fun and adventurous Pathfinder, then this is the group for you!

*If your thing is to see ALL of the major tourist attractions, join us.
*If you are single, or a solo traveler looking for a travel buddy, join us.

results.description:
Welcome to the Gampopa Center in Annapolis! We are a community of Buddhist students and practitioners located in Eastport. Our center is located at 424 Fourth Street in Annapolis. We gather six times a week to study and practice: we recite traditional chants, practice various meditation techniques, discuss traditional texts, and more. Please take a look at our ongoing calendar for upcoming meetups.

ABOUT THE CENTER

The Gampopa Center was founded in 2009 in Annapolis, Maryland, by Lama Phurbu Tashi Rinpoche based on the Buddhist understanding that the teachings of Buddha can bring us peace, happiness, and freedom. Lama’s students were excited to welcome a qualified Tibetan Buddhist teacher into the community and wanted to provide a place for learning and practicing Dharma. 

As a growing community of lay Dharma practitioners, we are grounded in but not limited to the Karma Kagyü lineage. The Center consists of a small shrine room, and we are actively looking to enlarge our facility.

ABOUT OUR MAIN TEACHER

Our community is grateful for the opportunity to learn and practice under the direction of an authentic, accomplished guide, Lama Phurbu Tashi Rinpoche. 

Born in Tibet in 1973, he is a monk, scholar, and author. The Dalai Lama and the Seventeenth Gyalwang Karmapa have glowingly endorsed his book The Lamp of Reasoning and Scriptures of the Sage, the Buddha. 

He has completed a traditional three-year retreat under the guidance of the Very Venerable Bokar Rinpoche, who subsequently appointed Lama Phurbu Tashi Rinpoche to be a three-year-retreat teacher. He has received advanced Buddhist training from masters in India, Sikkim, and Nepal. Now a citizen of the United States, Lama Phurbu Tashi Rinpoche makes his home in Annapolis, Maryland.

______________________________________

The Gampopa Center has an open door policy. Friends and members are welcome to come and go as you wish. While we do not charge for most sessions, you are welcome to make a donation if you are so moved.
results.name: Gampopa Center Meetup (Annapolis)

results.description:
A community of people in the DC metro area who are some flavor of polyamorous/ethically nonmonogamous who are also trying to raise tiny humans (or very much want to!) into functional, awesome adults amidst it all, and also maybe do other stuff in their lives. Join us for conversations online and off, potlucks, game nights, serious discussions, playdates, and who knows what else.

This group is geared toward people with experience in nonmonogamous relationships, who either also have children or are interested in having children. The scope of this group is to specifically connect about the intersection of parenting and people with multiple partners. 

To create a safe space for our members to freely meet and connect and express themslves, we ask that everyone agree to honor confidentiality, and act with honesty and respect. The identity of members and what is shared online or at events is to remain confidential. At events and online please be honest with and respectful of other members. 

This group welcomes people of all sexual and relationship orientations and identities, religious affiliations, spiritual beliefs, races and ethnic backgrounds, physical appearances and abilities, ages or other personal particulars.

Note: Some folks are concerned about confidentiality. No one can see that you've joined this group unless they are a member. For maximum privacy, you should also make certain you change your account settings so as not to display your Meetup memberships. All members must be approved by the group administrator before joining.
