results.description:
Endless wars, school shootings, racial violence, and senseless killing around the world dominate the news. World leaders promise solutions to these problems, but consistently fall short. How can we live with hope in such a hopeless world? Prophecies found in the books of Daniel and Revelation speak in great detail about the world we live in today and the hope that can be found in our future.


Key Benefits:

Understand why the world is falling into darkness

Grasp God’s plan of hope for humanity

Discover the evidence God will act soon

Gain the tools you and your family need to survive the coming crisis

Find peace and joy in your life today


Prophecies of Hope is a Bible study designed to take away the mystique and fear of Bible prophecy. Probably no other Bible topic has been more misunderstood and confused than prophecy, and it doesn't need to be. Once people attend Prophecies of Hope they learn that they can understand prophecy on their own. Don't Miss Opening Night!

JOIN TODAY and receive on opening night a free prophecy DVD entitled The Daniel Chronicles: Unlocking Prophetic Timelines. This DVD documentary will inspire you with confidence that the Bible can be trusted and that Jesus Christ really is the Savior of the world.

results.description:
Over getting wasted at parties every weekend?
Not quite resigned yourself to a life of crocheting toilet paper covers and talking to your plants?

Then come be social and fun with us!

We're a group of mostly single, mostly child-free women in our 30s, living around Montgomery County (namely, Silver Spring).

Past Meetups Have Included:
Happy Hours/Dinners
Book clubs
Food Truck Festivals
Winery/Brewery Tours and Tastings
Local Art and Music Festivals
Movies
Day trips to beaches, gardens, and parks
Spa days

..... really anything that is fun awesome girlfriend type stuff! :)

Our Guidelines
(please read before joining!)

1) If plans change, and you cannot make an event you RSVP'd ''Yes" to, please be considerate of the people attending, on the wait list, and/or hosting the event, and update your RSVP to "No" at least 24 hours prior to the event.

(This is the only time to RSVP as a "No" - if you are *changing* your RSVP. Please do not RSVP "No" in advance to every event listed on the entire calendar you already know you can't attend.)

2) If you do not show up to an event without giving 24 hours notice, you will be counted as a "No Show."

3) People who "No Show" 3 times, will be put on restriction and will not be able to RSVP or attend events for 3 months. The Event Organizers definitely understand that situations can come up at the last minute that you can't always control, which is why we give you 3.

4) "No shows" will eventually be removed from members account, based on your attendance at other events.

5) To cover the cost the organizers pay Meetup.com to run the group, we ask for members to contribute $3.00 in yearly dues. Please pay your dues within 3 weeks of joining (and then by Oct 1 each year after), or you will be removed from group events (especially those where paid members are on the wait list) until you pay. The link to pay is on the left side of the page.

Note: You might also be able to arrange to buy me a beer at one of our events in exchange for dues. Just arrange this in advanced so you aren't removed from an event and so I don't have 5 people offering me a beer at one event. ;)

6) A clear picture of your face is required to join the group, so we can recognize you at events.

These policies have been put into place to encourage respectfulness and active participation in the group.

Thank you for your attention to these policies! :)

results.description:
We invite you to join us for our next Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) class in Annapolis. You will find that MBSR is a simple, direct, and effective approach to life that addresses stress and encourages health. It offers a unique combination of internal skills and their practical application to health and wellbeing.

This course is based upon the MBSR program developed by Dr. Jon Kabat-Zinn in the School of Medicine at the University of Massachusetts. MBSR has been featured on PBS in Bill Moyer's documentary "Healing and The Mind", the Oprah Winfrey Show, NBC's Dateline, ABC's Evening News, CNN with Anderson Cooper, and hundreds of newspapers, magazines, and research articles.

We will meet for an introduction/orientation, eight 2.5-hour long weekly classes, and one six-hour day-long workshop. This practical course includes: • Exploration into the nature of Mindfulness • Skills that enhance awareness and help manage stress • Instruction in mindfulness meditation • Group dialogue & discussions • Gentle stretching & mindful yoga • Daily home assignments • MBSR text book & handouts • CD containing guided meditation practices • Follow-up phone interviews with the instructor
results.name: Annapolis Meditation & Stress Reduction Classes

results.description:
"Christian and Hopeful, as they journeyed towards the celestial city said to themselves...."

Are you in a big church where you feel like you don't know other members or are young adults activities being organized for people under 25 and somehow you don't fit the full women or men's ministry range? Or you just don't see people in your age range in church!

Are you Christian and looking to socialize with others but not into meetups for young people that seem to be always centered around happy hours?

Are you looking for activity partners or just looking to expand your social circle of Christian friends? I'm hoping to create a meetup where young Christians can socialize together.

My goal is to create an active meetup where members can engage in activities such as dinners, concerts/shows, faith and book discussions, museums, dance activities, mini golf, bowling day trips, whatever, even taking a sushi-making class (it's more fun than it sounds). I'm also very open to suggestions. If you have an interest in something else, let me know. I'll usually try something at least once.

So, to complete Bunyan's Pilgrim Progress Reference at the beginning Christian and hopeful said to themselves ..."To prevent drowsiness in this place, let us fall into good discourse."

In the words of Spurgeon "Christians who isolate themselves and walk alone, are very liable to grow drowsy. Hold Christian company, and you will be kept wakeful by it, and refreshed and encouraged to make quicker progress in the road to heaven".

I've lived in multiple places growing up, learned several languages and I enjoy doing multiple activities. I'm a health professional who's got a bit of me in the financial sector.  So, I'm hoping to create a meetup where we can meet, people from various backgrounds, professions, etc.,  and hopefully make lasting friendships and have fun. Anyone in the Maryland, Delaware, Virginia, DC area is welcome to join. Christians and curious non-christians are welcome.Target range 21-45.

VETworking of Anne Arundel County is designed to be a networking group for small business owners who are vets and located in the Anne Arundel County area.  VETS will refer VETS for homeowner services of all types.   VETworking is not restricted to just 1 like service.  ALL and ANY service that is provided to a homeowner is welcome to join.  There is potential for group advertising, referrals, and networking.  

     If at least 30 small businesses show interest then we can move forward from there.  If you ARE NOT a VET, and not located in the Anne Arundel County area please do not join.  

     I get request for but not limited to HVAC, power washers, plumbers, roofers, insulation, painters and pest control.  My goal would be to have a list of VETS in these and other homeowner service businesses that could be given leads,

results.description: Remember your favorite project ideas that could have made it big? Do you miss your college days, staying up late with friends to code the next hit game? It's easy to let our ideas get lost in the shuffle trying to maintain a work-life balance. These pet projects are more than pipe-dreams: they are central to who we are as people. As a group, we can encourage each other to help these ideas thrive. The focus of this group is to nurture innovation through collaborative discussion and fun challenges. We're excited to meet coders, designers, testers, and anyone else wanting to be involved in the development life-cycle. Come share your knowledge, learn about new technologies, and connect with us. My name is Dustin Bray. I'm a patented developer who is passionate about the creative use of technology. I look forward to seeing you at one of our meetings.

results.description:
Develop apps? Websites? Games? Inventions? Need fresh eyes to take a look at it? How about critical & honest feedback?

Beta BOOST is an advanced Meetup for startup founders, inventors, and garage engineers. Everyone is invited to attend our events to have their project tested by peers and professionals. 

Our mission is to give you a BOOST in productivity, reality, & your network. We don't just show up to exchange business cards, every person who attends an event leaves with action items from the group's suggestions & concerns to take back to the office/garage for refinement. 

Event formats

Mini-Sessions: 8-12 attendees - We test 1 project together at a time which unfolds in a tidal wave of concerns/suggestions. This happens generally at coffee shops or restaurants for a small fee. To attend you can bring your project or just yourself (projects are never required). If you just want to check out what's new and give feedback, please attend!

Large Session: 30+ attendees - These events will include a larger scale speed testing format where everyone is partner-ed up for 10 minutes. Testing begins and every 10 minutes we switch partners. 

There will be larger mixers, keynotes, & special testing events in the future. We look to invite experts in UI/UX, project management, product development, mobile development, etc not to talk about their field but act as a panel of star testers that will give expert advice on individual projects.

Lets get Annapolis Tech moving forward, faster!
results.name: Beta BOOST (Annapolis)

results.description: This group is to provide community for working parents. results.description:
Hey Greater Baltimore! My name is Kelly Lawrence and I am so passionate about my church, Messiah Community Church (MCC), I am looking for any and every way to share it with others. Growing up in "the church" (as it's often called), I thought I knew all there was to know about Christianity, yet once I became an adult, traditions, hymns, dresses, scriptures (without context), and ol' sayings didn't work for me. I had REAL problems so I need a REAL relationship with God. The problem was, I didn't realize I didn't have one. I thought going through the religious motions was the relationship. No one explained the why, what, and how to me until I got to MCC. 

With bible-based, life application teachings by Former Baltimore Ravens Chaplin (1999-2013), Pastor Rod Hairston, every Sunday is a "real talk", mind-opening experience on how to improve yourself, your World and your life for the benefit of all mankind and to the glory of God. The worship is phenomenal, the teaching is relevant, and the service is an express 75 minutes flat (Can I get an Amen)! 

I'm so blessed to have found this gem so I want to be a blessing and share it with everyone. I'll tell you the story about how I ended up at MCC when we see each other (and ooohh it's God glorifyingly goooood) but in the interim, I want to invite you to join my Meetup group for updates on all things MCC to include; 

*Small Groups (If you're not thinking, talking, crying, praying and laughing at your current small group... you're doing it wrong. Join US!) 

*Community Events (Free food, fun and love September 12th at our Church Dedication and Family Fun Day!) 

*Worship Services (every Sunday at 9:30 and 11! Check out this FORTIFYING message from a couple weeks ago -- http://media.perpetuatech.com/watch?v=QUNBQUM2QzNEMg#stha... 

*Outreach Opportunities (Aaaaahhhhh the joys of service :-)) 

*And much, much, MUCH MORE! 

The people are so genuine and loving you may not even bother finding me but, if you come, please look for me so we can connect! See you soon :-) 


Blessings, 

-Kelz

At WOC we believe that, like a golf swing, life is a work in progress. We show the value of the game beyond the scorecard in the form of friendships, business opportunities, fitness, outdoors, fashion, personal fulfillment and much more.  By creating events that shift the focus away from competition and to enjoying the benefits of the lifestyle, we’ve made golf rewarding and fun.

While our organization’s events are posted through Meetup, the benefits of being a WOC member far exceed the entertaining play days and signatures we host. Becoming a member of WOC through our site will reward you with a year of perks including social and business networking, access to members-only events, discounts at all events and so much more! To learn more about our membership options and benefits, click HERE.

results.description:
Who are we?
Vin et Livres is the Washington DC all women's wine and cheese book club! With founding chapters in Miami and Fort Lauderdale, Florida, Vin et Livres has founded a new chapter located in the Beltway area. We attract chic, stylish, fascinating ladies from all walks of life with an avid interest in literature and a pallet for wine and cheese. Are you a  professional lady with eclectic interests, a penchant for good books and a passion for wine? If yes, then Vin et Livres is for you. 

Monthly book club meetings
Vin et Livre meets the first Tuesday of every month at a lovely central location. A themed wine and cheese province accompanied by alluring music from the region set the ambience. Meetings are loosely structured beginning with open meet and greet, introductions, brief discussion of the wine province and sampling of delectable eats (someone is always bringing delicious goodies!). In-depth, spirited discussion of the subject novel follows. Never a boring minute, guaranteed! 

Monthly socials
Vin et Livres monthly socials present a more relaxed and lively environment in which we ladies can mingle and get to know one another outside of the more structured book club meetings. We meet at a different location every month as decided by the majority at the previous book club meeting. Attendees must be members of Vin et Livres.

What to bring to the book club meetings
Each lady brings a bottle of the themed wine (not just wine from any province) and a chunk of cheese from the themed province. She also brings her book of the month. Your hostess provides the music.

À votre santé!
results.name: DC Wine and Literature Book Club for Women

results.description: The Rotary Club of Parole (Annapolis) is comprised of approximately 65 members, who enthusiastically share and demonstrate the Rotary philosophy. We are a service club that significantly improves lives in our local community and around the world by meeting real needs. Our vision "We will make a positive difference for youth today, so they will make a difference tomorrow." Rotary’s guiding principle is Service Above Self. Rotarians develop community service projects that address many of today's most critical issues---children at risk, health & hunger, water and literacy. We support programs for youth; educational opportunities and international exchanges for students and professionals; and vocational and career development and much more. Our Club's signature project is the Books for International Goodwill, Inc. which takes used books for shipment to needy schools and libraries, and since 1995, has saved books from the landfill and shipped over 5 million books to help spread literacy throughout the world. Rotary is an international organization of business and professional leaders united through a shared commitment to humanitarian service. We Rotarians are dedicated to fostering goodwill and peace around the world while upholding high ethical standards in the conduct of our vocational and professional endeavors. Rotary...Humanity in Motion.
results.name: Rotary Club of Parole Annapolis MD Club Meetup

results.description:
Daydreaming at your desk? Wandering the bookstore travel section, wishing yourself away? Whether you've been to a lot of places or just hope to go someday, let's bring a bit of the wide world home right now. We'll read travel writing from around the globe, see travel films, talk about our experiences and plans, and inspire each other to hit the road. Maybe you'll even make a friend to take with you.

Book, movie and event suggestions welcome. I'm also open to organizing short trips, perhaps to DC for events at National Geographic.

**Did you know that organizing a Meetup is not free? We're now over the "basic" 50 person membership limit ($10/mo), and on to Unlimited ($15/mo). Please consider tossing a dollar or two toward the group, so I can keep it open to any and everyone who wants to join!

results.description:
Beginning and experienced singers alike will find a place to spread their vocal wings in The Freedom Choir. Liberate your voice and revel in the age-old tradition of singing together in a beautiful environment. Led by Elizabeth Melvin, The Freedom Choir sings a soulful and uplifting repertoire from around the corner and around the globe. Using the time-honored method of call and response to learn new songs, you will be thrilled at how quickly you will be singing with others in 4-part harmonies.

-No Audition, No Experience Required!

-Learn songs in the oral tradition, line by line in call and response.

-Sheet music and lyrics occasionally provided, but you need not read music.

-Explore vocal music and harmonies from South Africa, Irish blessings, Taize chant,
African-American Gospel, Appalachian folk, Americana, new singer-songwriters and much more!

-Relaxing warm-up at the beginning of every night gets you ready to sing.

-Get your rhythm on with occasional body percussion and dance moves to accompany songs.

-A fun, convivial atmosphere! We laugh a lot!

-We sing in a church, but are not affiliated with any religion, creed or political belief.

-The 12-week Fall Session starts Thursday, Sept. 17.  Cost is $120 for the session, payable in full the first night or by installments through arrangement with the director, Elizabeth Melvin.  New members can attend the first two weeks (9/17 & 9/24) for the drop-in rate of $12 per night - if you decide to commit to the full session, the balance due will be pro-rated.

www.thefreedomchoir.com
results.name: The Freedom Choir (Annapolis)

results.description:
The Gay Men's Dinner Club is a monthly social group for gay and bi men who want to meet and make new friends in D.C., MD., and Northern Virginia, and also enjoy an evening out that includes good food.

We are a great way for gay and bi men to meet and make new friends.  We meet monthly (usually one Sunday per month) and go to a variety of different restaurants. We do try and find venues that are not expensive.

Usually, we hang out after the dinner at a bar near where we've just eaten for those who wish to continue our dinner conversation.  

Occasionally, we meet at different times or different days and do other social things.

This is not a dating or hookup group, so I don’t care what you look like; however, you need to have a profile photo of your face to be approved for this group. Or, if you don’t want everyone to be able to see your face, you can message me with it, and I’ll approve you. I need to ensure you are a real person.  If I approve you without your face photo and you don't send it to me within a couple of days, you'll be removed. Sorry for having to do this, but there are a lot of non-serious guys online.  Showing a face photo indicates serious, since so many guys join these groups, sometimes with fake profiles, and/or never attend anything.

I hope you join and to see you at a dinner very soon.
results.name: The Gay Men's Dinner Club

topics.name: Gay Men Who Like Rock Music

results.description:
Hey, guys,

I created this group because of my observations and experiences of the challenges of becoming friends with gay and bi men who are just normal, regular guys, not part of "the gay scene," and who do not fit the common stereotypes of gay men. Gay men face common gay stereotypes and clichés, not just from the straight world but also from our own “gay community.”

By "gay scene," I mean gay bars, gay restaurants, "LGBT(Q)" political meetings, gay pride parades, gay brunches, and drag shows.  In the gay scene, you meet the same kinds of gay people (cliché gays also known as "basic gays," doing the same things (like going to drag shows) over and over again.  So as a non-scene group, we do not do these things as a group. We set ourselves apart and we have events away from the scene.

We are also not part of "gay culture." This is not a group for guys who call themselves "queer" or "girl" or who are over-the-top or provocative and who find female pop artists and fashion really important. Some gay men like rock music and sports. This group is for gay guys who do not act like stereotypical black females and do not think mockery of them is funny (it's actually racist), for whom camp is not their typical humor, who are not exaggeratedly feminine, and who do not frequent gay bars. 

This is a group for gay guys who identify as masculine and normal. Recently, transgender men have come to dominate gay media outlets, confusing people into perceiving transgender men to be gay men. Transgender is not the same as gay. We support transgender rights, however, most gay men are not men who want to be women. We are gay and bi men who like being men.

This is a group for gay guys who are seeking new friends to hang with, go to movies with, and have dinners with, away from the gay scene.  I think these kinds of gay guys are the majority of gay men, but people may not perceive that to be so, because popular culture and "gay culture" perpetuate and reinforce gay stereotypes and cliches.  Here is social space that connects normal gay guys offline, in real life, at places other than gay bars, such as coffee shops, private homes, sports events, and restaurants. Unlike the common cliche gays, we won’t be wearing purple wigs in this group and posting the pics on Facebook or Meetup. We're not like that. 

Last, this group is not about hooking up with other guys, which is also another common stereotype of gay men. Being gay is mostly not about sex. 

If you're looking for something different from and better than the gay scene that defines and limits so many gay guys, then this group is for you. Non-Scene Gay Guys is for gay and bi men in their 20s, 30s, and a few in their 40s, who have interests outside of gay culture and want to hang out, make friends, and have fun, doing social activities away from the gay scene. If you are interested, join us!
results.name: Non-Scene Gay Guys

results.description: Are you a single professional Jewish white man or Professional Black woman in search of your soul mate? Are you open to dating outside of your race in your search for a life partner? results.description:
This group is for those who love reading, eating, and are even happier when they can combine the two! "Voracious: A Hungry Reader Cooks Her Way through Great Books" is this group's inspiration. Join us while we read great novels and culminate our literary experiences through lively discussion and delicious food inspired by the literature.

How does this book club work?

At the beginning of each month, we pick a novel (genres and themes vary wildly, so there's lot of variety) and spend the month reading at leisure. Towards the end of the month, we meet up at somewhere in DC to discuss the book and dive into some delicious literature-themed food, whether that be cooking up recipes inspired by the novel or enjoying a meal at a restaurant representative of our book. As foodies who love to read, it gives us the chance to indulge our intellect and our stomachs at the same time.

What if I don't finish the book?

It doesn't matter! As long as you don't mind spoilers, we want you to be there.

Do you only read books?

Not at all; we will sprinkle in movies based on books, plays, book festivals and the like to keep things interesting and provide other means to enjoy what great writing has to offer.
results.name: Voracious: A Foodie Book Club

results.description:
Description

Montgomery County's own Ruby meetup! At each meetup, we expect to have a talk followed by a social at a nearby pub or tavern. Neophytes and experts are all welcome!

Code of Conduct

United Silver Spring Ruby (USSR) is dedicated to providing a respectful, harassment-free community for its members (henceforth known as "comrades"). We do not tolerate harassment or bullying of any comrade in any form. This does not only extend to comrades local to the USSR community but to anyone who chooses to become involved in the larger USSR community, developers and integrators through events or interactions.


Harassment includes offensive verbal/electronic comments related to personal characteristics or choices, sexual images or comments in public or online spaces, deliberate intimidation, bullying, stalking, following, harassing photography or recording, sustained disruption of talks, online chats, electronic meetings, physical meetings or other events, inappropriate physical contact, or unwelcome sexual attention. Participants asked to stop any harassing or bullying behavior are expected to comply immediately.


If a participant engages in harassing behavior, representatives of the community may take reasonable action they deem appropriate, including warning the offender, expulsion from any USSR event, or expulsion from mailing lists, IRC chats, discussion boards and other electronic communications channels to resolve the issue. This may include expulsion from USSR Meetup group membership.


If you are being harassed, notice that someone else is being harassed, or have any other concerns, please act to intercede or ask for help from any comrade of the USSR community, online chat admins, website admins, or organizers/representatives of any physical events put on under the auspices of USSR.


This Code of Conduct has been adapted from Pyladies and is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 3.0 Unported license
results.name: United Silver Spring Ruby

results.description:
Due to the extensive growth of our DMV club, we are super excited to launch a Baltimore group. If you've dreamed of unplugging from your busy life to take time out for yourself, relax, let your hair down, re-ignite your passion, nourish yourself, expand your awareness, belly laugh, and just have fun in a community of sisterhood, you'll feel right at home with Pumps & Passports™ Network.  We're a National social travel network with Regional Travel Clubs created to support professional African-American women over 30 who love to connect, engage, travel and explore the world and All women are welcome!  We connect women from all walks of life, backgrounds and ages - to enjoy a style of travel that is attractive to women - the opportunity to travel without a partner and not feel excluded, vulnerable or alone.  Pumps & Passports™ Network enjoys travel to fun destinations around the region, the nation and the world in a trusting community of sisterhood. 

Pumps & Passports™ - Baltimore Regional Club enjoys inspiring REGIONAL TRIPS & MONTHLY SOCIAL EVENTS  (dining, adventure, leisure day trips, 1 - 3 day weekend getaways and more) to create memorable experiences for women like you - who dream of getting away and traveling more but simply don't want to do it alone. We travel together in a safe and nurturing atmosphere, while sharing cuisines, culture, stories, laughter and adventure.

• Our Travel Network hosts Girlfriend Weekend Getaways for those who will maintain an ACTIVE membership, attend a Social event within the first three (3) months of joining, remain current with the annual $10 Meetup fee, and attend one travel trip a year or risk being removed from the travel club.

• Our Weekend Girlfriend Getaways are recommended if you are 30 years old with the ability to authenticate your ID through your Facebook or LinkedIn account.

• Our Weekend Girlfriend Getaways will be for groups of 10 or more. Transportation will be by chartered motorcoach, 15-Passenger Van, 7 passenger SUV or train for regional travel trips.

• Our Weekend Girlfriend Getaways will be travel trips ranging between 2-6 hours maximum drive time. 

• Our Weekend Girlfriend Getaways will be from Friday through Sunday and may require an early Friday departure so that we may accommodate drive time and still enjoy the most fun during of the weekend.

• Our Weekend Girlfriend Getaways will require a $25.00 commitment deposit due at the time of RSVP.

• Our Weekend Girlfriend Getaways will include the expense for the transportation rental, taxes, fuel, tolls, gratuities and parking fees for the transport.

• Our Weekend Girlfriend Getaways are designed to make each travel weekend as cost efficient as possible by traveling as a group.

Connect with us!  LIKE the Pumps & Passports™ Facebook page or  FOLLOW the Pumps & Passports LinkedIn Page!  Visit the Pumps & Passports™ Network website for the latest National and International destinations!

***************

This group is for YOU if you are a professional woman over 30 years of age & enjoy socializing, traveling, networking, are positive and desire to gather in a social circle of positive sisterhood for dining, adventure, recreation, leisure Trips & weekend girlfriend getaways.

*** Pumps & Passports™ is a REAL SOCIAL NETWORK for women who want to travel, not just the next Meetup group, so engagement is REQUIRED for MEMBERS who are:

1)  serious about traveling, whether frequently or occasionally,

2)  serious about being active in the travel club's Social events and

3)  serious about being connected in a POSITIVE SOCIAL CIRCLE of Sisterhood.

At Pumps & Passports™, "It's a Woman's World, And We Deserve To See It!"  Leave the detailed planning to us - just grab your favorite pumps (sandals or flip flops) & passport and come join us on the beaches of the world.  All are welcome to join!

$10 Annual Meetup fee.  Travel agents are NOT approved for membership!

**************

DISCLAIMER:  Pumps & Passports™  Travel Network is 100% committed to Positive Social Circle of Sisterhood and Universal Principals.  Pumps & Passports™ Network has ZERO TOLERANCE for whiners, loners, complainers, gossipers, cattiness, negative attitudes, disruptors, drama, rudeness to travel partners and service providers, profanity and overall detractors of the group being able to enjoy a pleasant Sisterhood Social experience.***

Membership confirms your agreement with the Pumps & Passports™ Guidelines, Policies and Terms & Conditions.  Participation in activities and events is strictly voluntary.  Members & Participants assume all risks in connection with activities.  Organizers, Event Hosts, and Travel Club Leaders are released from any and all forms of liability related to Pumps & Passports™ Socials, Events and Travel Trips.
results.name: Pumps & Passports℠ Baltimore 👠

topics.name: Sing Barbershop Harmony and Ring those chords!!!

results.description: We meet at 7 pm every Thursday evening at the Trinity United Methodist Church Auditorium located at 1300 West Street, Annapolis, Maryland 21401. The Sons of the Severn is an award-winning men's choral ensemble based in Annapolis, Maryland. We are proud members of the Barbershop Harmony Society (officially the Society for the Preservation and Encouragement of BarberShop Quartet Singing in America, Inc., or SPEBSQSA). The chorus performs a diverse repertoire of American popular music, including Tin Pan Alley classics, pop standards, novelty songs, and seasonal favorites. We complement our singing with innovative staging, movement, and dialogue, to create a unique and memorable experience for our audiences. All of our music is arranged for four voice parts and sung a cappella (unaccompanied). The male singers in our group come from various musical backgrounds, having sung in high school and college a cappella groups, madrigals, church choirs, opera, musical theater, and even heavy metal bands. We are a volunteer organization. The men who sing with us are regular guys from all professions...executives, teachers, engineers, physicians, military, skilled laborers, and more. They come from Baltimore and Washington, DC, and everywhere in between. The Sons of the Severn name is an homage to the Severn River, which runs through Annapolis, the state capital of Maryland and home to the United States Naval Academy. The chorus represents the Anne Arundel County, Maryland Chapter of the Barbershop Harmony Society. Our chapter was founded in 1949, the third chapter to charter in the Society's Mid-Atlantic District.
results.name: A.A. Co. Men's Barbershop Chorus - The Sons of the Severn

results.description:
The Mid-Atlantic Antique Radio Club (MAARC.org) is a hobby club for those dedicated to collecting, restoring, and preserving vintage electronics. Collecting antique radio, television, hi-fi audio/stereo, and test equipment is a fun and interesting pastime that appeals to a variety of folks. Members include pure collectors who are looking for their next great find, technicians and tinkerers who like to restore the electronics or refinish cabinets, historians and preservationists interested in the history of the technology, and those who are into it as a small business. Many involved dabble in several of these areas. All enjoy the camaraderie of a shared interest. You will find vintage electronics collectors to be a friendly and honest group that do not take themselves too seriously, while recognizing they are preserving a part of our heritage.

You are cordially invited to join

MAARC guests are invited to attend any of our monthly 3rd Sunday meetings in Davidsonville, MD (Feb, Mar, May, Jul, Aug, Sep, Nov) or Centreville, VA (Apr, Dec). Tailgate sales for these events start at 11:00 AM, with the meeting, including a Show and Tell and a topical presentation, starting at 1:00 PM. This is followed by a monthly auction of a wide variety of vintage electronics. MAARC members enjoy monthly meetings with techies who share similar interests and passions. Special Events throughout the Year Our October RadioFallFest in Davidsonville kicks off at 7:00 AM with a huge auction at noon. Other events include our January Winterfest at the National Electronics Museum (NEM) in Linthicum, MD near BWI airport, and our 3 day RadioActivity event held in June at a conference facility within the DC/Baltimore region. For additional information, visit our website at: MAARC.ORG

How will MAARC Benefit Me?

MAARC members receive monthly copies of our vintage radio journal Radio Age Newsletter, containing interesting and informative articles. They are also entitled to access past Radio Age Newsletter copies, an extensive library of service literature available from the National Capital Radio and Television Museum (NCRTV) which was created by MAARC, discounts for NEM and NCRTV membership, and our members-only Discussion Forums.

We have the best auctions on the East Coast!

Our monthly auction brings in all sorts of interesting stuff. Who knows what treasure will show up at the auction block! Members often come back the following month to show off their auction find.

Come join the fun!
results.name: Mid-Atlantic Antique Radio Club (MAARC.org)

It is our quest to integrate great teachings and knowledge into our lives and to effectively influence the lives of those around us who are seeking more meaning and fulfillment.

We’ll be hosting workshops- to support your higher levels of thought for shifting beliefs and accelerating personal growth, and exploring how the Laws of the Universe can be applied to create a life you love at any age.

We also plan a 'book of the month' club, where we'll read texts like, "Conversations With God', "The Secret for Teens" and 'Think & Grow Rich", and discuss how to apply the principles to our lives.

Moving as one to these rhythms, we learn about our basic relationships of being in the body, being on Earth, being in community and being present to the source of all life. The dances evoke joy, peace, introspection, inspiration, healing and a powerful sense of interconnection and community. topics.name: offering hope & support to the homeless community

results.description: We seek singers for a new community choir that aims to raise money to alleviate homelessness. Singers of all varieties and skill levels for this experimental, volunteer choir are welcome. The aim of the choir is to create fellowship and beautiful music, music to be sung at small events and on street corners for the purposes of raising donations to alleviate and fight homelessness. This charitable model would be to advertise that half of all donations raised on a single occasion would go straight to feed individuals finding themselves on the streets that same evening. The other half would be given to a local, District focused non-profit that fights homelessness and helps individuals "step-up" out of abject poverty. Samaritan Ministry of Greater Washington pursues to promote awareness of community needs, foster partnerships at all levels, break down barriers imposed by poverty, and develop participants’ abilities to help themselves to better lives. Check our their website for more information. Once we have enough people to get going, we will have rehearsals once a week, with evening, street performances to be either once a week, once every other week, or once a month. Such a detail would be decided by the members of the newly formed group and reviewed bi-annually.
results.name: Samaritan Singers: Washington Choir to Fight Homelessness

results.description:
Elizabeth Melvin leads you into an experience of the healing power of voices raised together in song. Singing is a heart-felt way of centering and connecting to a deep core of joy in our inner selves and to others in the song circle. In this monthly workshop, songs will be taught in the oral tradition, using call-and-response, making them accessible to beginners and experienced singers alike. Singers will explore ancient and modern chants, rounds and songs from all over the globe that express the timeless themes of gratitude, love, connection and peace. Come immerse yourself in the life-enhancing vibrations of harmony and rhythm in the beautiful tree-top studio at Ridgely Retreat in Annapolis. No experience or music reading ability required. You are guaranteed to leave with a smile on your face and a song in your heart!

Singer and multi-instrumentalist Elizabeth Melvin is the founding director of The Freedom Choir and the Annapolis Morning Song Circle. She is dedicated to providing opportunities for everyone to experience the life-affirming tradition of singing together.
results.name: Harmony and Healing through Song

results.description: "Mindfulness is a deceptively simple way of relating to experience that has been practiced for over 2,500 years to alleviate human suffering. In recent years, clinicians are discovering that mindfulness holds great promise for both their own personal development and as a way to enhance therapeutic relationship. " As a practitioner of mindfulness meditation over the past fifteen years, I have come to appreciate the balance that mindfulness has brought into both my personal as well as my professional life. The sense of grounding that comes with regular practice, has been so helpful in supporting me in facing the challenges of daily life. Please come join me once a month on the third Saturday from 2 to 4 pm to study, practice, and explore bringing mindfulness into our professional lives. Each 2 hour gathering will include sitting meditation, video and book based discussions, as well as an opportunity to share our own experiences in clinical practice. Donation appreciated to cover costs. Starting October 24th.
results.name: Silver Spring Mindful Mental Health Professionals Meetup

topics.name: A Course in Miracles Study Group
A Course In Miracles study and sharing group

results.description:
The inspiration of the Baltimore-ACIM Study Group is to advance the spiritual principles shared in "A Course In Miracles." The study group is open to all interested seekers and practitioners of the Course. We hope to share lessons and ignite spiritual/personal transformation through mediation, group discussions and support in the effort to be self-forgiving and love focused. We wish to inspire new thought so come experience A Course In Miracles.

We are a group excited to expand the lessons of ACIM. As miracle workers, we hope to be a source for individual motivation and healing of the world. As stated in the Course: "Our brother's needs become our own, because they are taking the journey with us as we go to God. Without us they would lose their way. Without them we could never find our own." This passage promotes service as hour inheritance. Therefore, a central goal of the Study Group is to offer to others what we have learned ourselves. And to promote modalities like meditation, yoga, thai chi and service which can be outlets to personal transformation.

Forgiveness is our true purpose. Through the ACIM Study Group we will remind the community of this fact in order to eliminate unbelief and create an environment for love to strengthen the spaces weakened by fear. With forgiveness and love as our pillars, we transcend the grievances of the world and connect with every opportunity to expand our the mission of miracles workers. As with The Course the Study Group: "does not aim at teaching the meaning of love, for that is beyond what can be taught. It does aim, however at removing the blocks to the awareness of love's presence, which is your natural inheritance."

Finally, The Study Group will remind and reassert that, "Nothing real can be threatened. Nothing unreal exists. Herein lies the peace of God." ACIM

Please join us. 

Upcoming meetings:

Thursday, November 12, 2015 - 6:30 p.m.  Introduction to discuss the mission and purpose of the ACIM Study Group and planning meeting for December launch event and 2016 Calendar year. 

Thursday, December 10, 2015 - 6:30 p.m. Kick-0ff Event and Open House to launch Study Group for 2016 Calendar year. 

Currently, all study group meetings are tentatively scheduled for Thursdays beginning at 6:30 p.m. beginning in 2016. Meetings will be held at the Afya Community Center for Healing and Mindfulness located at 4151 Park Heights Avenue, Baltimore, MD 21215.

For additional information contact call: 443-610-0716 or email wflowers@phcha.org
results.name: A Course In Miracles Study Group: Baltimore

Feel free to join the group if you need an extra friend for all those activities your usual friends aren't interested in or if you're new in town like me and haven't quite formed a squad as magnificent as Taylor's. I'm not totally sure what this group will consist of, since I spend most of my time failing at Pinterest projects and watching way too much reality TV, but the overall goal is to meet at least one cool new person in the city.

This group is dedicated to working to advance legislation to increase the rights of citizens who have been incarcerated. We call ourselves "fighters" top emphasize that we intend to act and not just talk.

 In our first meeting we will view videos describing the problems faced by victims of mass incarceration and hear from returning citizens about the problems they faced and are facing. Then we will work on making concrete plans for activities to accomplish passage of that legislation.  In future meetings we will concentrate on planning and executing such activities.  Members will select the specific issues they wish to address and the specific activities they wish to engage in.  We will meet as a group to evaluate and plan our actions.  Join us if you are interested in planning events, lobbying, drafting legislation, speaking at local community groups, assisting in managing social media.

results.description:
This is a group for writers who subsist on ramen and Taco Bell, who were crazy enough to get a Liberal Arts degree (if any), and who think they are God's gift to storytelling. More importantly, this is a group for people who want to be published with every fiber of their being. For you, writing isn't a hobby, it's life, and you won't rest until your stories are in the heads of millions. Or at the very least, until you get some good Amazon reviews. Come hang out with us and write stuff, critique other members' works, get your work critiqued, and promote the value of reading and creative writing to the world.


CREED OF THE HUNGRY DERANGED WRITER

1) I love to write.

2) I accept that I'm not going to be as rich as my STEM/Business friends anytime soon, but I'll probably be more famous.

3) No I don't want to be a damn teacher.

4) There is no shame in going to an event I care nothing about if there's free food.

5) I will not fear critique. 

6) I will embrace the pressure to publish.

7) Seriously I don't want to fucking teach. 

8) Wait teachers get paid how much? 

9) I will not just complain about the "decline" of literary arts; I will show why they should be honored.

10) Sometimes, I'll chip in for food for other starving writers to munch on.
results.name: Columbia Starving Crazy Writers

results.description:

• Was she extremely manipulative?

• Did she have unreasonably high expectations that you could never meet?

• Did you experience betrayal or abandonment from your mother or father?

Welcome  to Adult Children of Narcissists Support group. Glad you found us. May you find here hope, camaraderie and support for healing and recovery. 

The psychological manipulation by narcissists  contributes to the trauma that abandonment and betrayal can bring.  It is important for those of us who have experienced the psychological manipulation that characterizes this defensive personality style to meet other survivors and learn for ourselves that we are not alone.

We are a self-help group of women and men, 18 years or older, who are guided by a set of 12 Suggested Steps and 12 Traditions adapted to our situation from Adult Children of Alcoholics or ACA. Everything that is said in the group meeting or member to member must be held in strict confidence. 

The only membership requirement is that you want to recover,and heal from narcissistic child abuse. (See Files under the More menu of this website for more information.)

• Let's experience that WE ARE NOT ALONE

• Let's listen to each other with EMPATHY

• Let's remind one another that our parent's narcissism was NOT OUR FAULT.

• Let's support one another by sharing our efforts at RECOVERY. 


Note:We do not have any professional therapist working in our group. ACN is not a replacement for therapy or any other professional service when needed.
results.name: Baltimore Adult Children of Narcissists Support

results.description:
Ok, I don't really believe that a zombie apocalypse will ever happen--though, full disclosure, a small part of me would freak out with a sort of crazy joy if it did. I use Zombies euphemism for anything that falls on the spectrum of disaster. I have found there are many skills I have that would be benefical for a disaster or collapse of society, and many skills I lack and would like to have. Bring your expertise to this group, whether it is mechanical, bushcraft, electrical, communications, medical, self-defense, logistics, or weaponary. Each meetup we will focus on a skill to help give us an edge in a disaster.

I'm a former volunteer firefighter/first responder. I've been firefighter 1 certified, hazmat operational level certified, P.A.L.S. certified, ACLS certified. I'm a registered nurse in school for my nurse practitioner and am a volunteer for the GWU Med Corp and have training in mass casualty events, pediatric emergencies, and radiological events. I hope you, like me, would love to connect with others and exchange knowledge, and practice skills with other people, and have fub doing it. Ideas for meetups:

- Mastering Knots <br>- Fitness for readiness in a post-apocalyptic world <br>- Basic First Aid <br>- Suture Proficiency <br>- Electricity 101 for disaster events <br>- Car Basics for disaster events <br>- Weather Watching <br>- Animal Tracking <br>- Trap Setting

And much, much more. If you're interested, join up for some paranoid fun! Bring your expertise and your desire to learn.
results.name: Zombie Survival Training Group

results.description:
Welcome to Baltimore Brunch for Charity were we drink and dine for a good cause! 

Lets put those bottomless Mimosas and Bloody Marys to good use!

 I organize various Brunch events with a set goal to raise money for various charities. The goals are specific and measurable hence you can track your contribution and see where each penny goes to and its impact on the organizations. 

You can look forward to : 

Drink and Food specials 

Meeting other locals Entertaining brunch partners and discussions 

as well as ultimately contributing towards a great charitable cause! 

Our current Sponsored Charity is Watsi! https://watsi.org 


What is Watsi? 


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AQmsL3fjptM

Watsi is a global crowdfunding platform that enables anyone to donate as little as $5 to directly fund life-changing healthcare for people around the world. Watsi is a registered U.S. 501(c)(3) non-profit organization (EIN: 45-3236734). 

Why Watsi?

100% of all donations to Watsi go to fund specific healthcare initiatives - hence the impact is immediate and measurable - you see how your money has an immediate impact! 

These treatments are sometimes a matter of life and death for these patients who cannot afford any healthcare and Watsi is there for them! 

To find out more about Watsi you can visit : https://watsi.org/faq

results.description:
This group is for mature adults who would like to do some traveling once or twice a year. There are many places in the world to visit and many things to see and experience. I know that there are many people out there that would like to travel, but may not have anyone to travel with. If you are one of those people, this maybe a good group for you to join. 

This group travels will coincide with my Forty & Over Group travel plans.  I know that there are several traveling groups out there, but I can assure you that you will be well taken care of as a member of my group and that your traveling experience will be GREAT!

There will also be selected meetups where you will be invited to come out and meet members of my Forty & Over Group. Since they will most likely be many of your traveling companions as well. Please take advantage of those selective meetups.

All initial payments for our travels will be deposit into my Paypal Account using my email address which will be given at the time of a trip. I will then take care of the initial payment of the trip. Afterwards, you will then have the option to pay directly to the source or continue to use my paypal account to make payments and I will continue to make your payments.

There will be a "Lets Talk About It Meetup" before each trip. This will be your opportunity to meet other members of the group as well as myself. These meetups are important if you may need a roommate. They re also important because they will give you a chance to meet and talk with me.

If you have any questions, please feel free to message me and I will respond.

It is also important for you to know that I am NOT a travel agent. I just happen to enjoy organizing and getting away.

We will also work on a few projects down the road to give back to the community through act of service and bringing awareness. We will learn our true self-worth and how it correlates with our network that turns into Net-worth (currently working on an ebook called "Knowing Your Self-Worth: Network To Net-worth). BELOW IS BACKGROUND ON ORGANIZER: <br>My name is Valissa Philogene, creator of DLEN, Encouraging Dynamic Women Radio, and She Soars Maryland Network Director. writers, musicians, thinkers, poets, programmers, the curious, designers, the curious, painters, sculptors, etc. 

A Salon of Creatives, Artists, and Thinkers is Coming 

Monthly beginning December 10 

A Sober Evening of Conversation with Creative Thinkers of all Stripes 

Wikipedia says a Salon is "a gathering of people under the roof of an inspiring host, held partly to amuse one another and partly to refine the taste and increase the knowledge of the participants through conversation." We don't have an inspiring host, or a roof of our own, but the rest is true. Sober as in no booze in the room, don't be drunk when you arrive. Other than that, pretty much as Wikipedia says. Come to amuse and conversate. Exchange ideas. Talk about anything except sobriety- there are plenty of places for that. This is about having a salon as old, just sober. 

All not under the influence at the door are welcome 

Not AA or 12 Step Affiliated 

Not Religiously Affiliated

Not a Support Group

results.description:
Baltimore Women in Politics, brings together a diverse group of women representing all areas of the  Baltimore city. Members include women who are interested in running for elected office, women who are serving on campaigns, women who are running for office, women who are interested in Baltimore city politics  as well as those who are dedicated to promoting the election of women to public offices.

The groups objectives are to:

• Enhance the skills and sharpen the techniques of women who are interested in running for public office.

• Galvanize the collective support of women throughout the city to increase the number of women elected to public office.

• Promote the issues of concern to women, especially those who are voiceless.

- Educate ourselves in the issues of concern to Baltimore residents

We must encourage women of all ages to run for office or be part of the process. Just being silent and ignoring the political system in Baltimore is not acceptable. This group we will empower women to run for city/county office and/or working on campaigns.  Men outnumber women in these roles by significant margins.

Fact: In the 110th Congress, we had a record number of women chairing committees, but that record is still only six chairs, out of roughly 40 committees. As the pipeline to political power begins early in life – 12 of the last 19 Presidents started their political careers before they were 35 years old, women often handicap themselves by not considering a run for office until much later in life than their male counterparts.

Join this meet up and let's start empowering each other to take a stand. Be political!
results.name: Baltimore Women in Politics Meetup

results.description: SMART Family and Friends is a peer support group for those who have a loved-one struggling with addiction, whether it be a substance-abuse disorder or other addictive behaviors. We meet weekly to offer one another mutual support, encouragement and guidance in navigating the challenges of our relationships to our loved ones. SMART ( Self- Management and Recovery Training) is a national non-12-step peer-support program based in cognitive-behavioral science. The SMART Family & Friends program provides communications strategies and recovery tools for family members, applying both the SMART tools and the CRAFT approach, used in the professional treatment community. ( CRAFT= Community Reinforcement and Family Training.)

results.description:
Welcome! <br>

Hey Baltimore, announcing my second Meetup Group for African-American Widows. The first Meetup, located in Charlotte, has been very beneficial to those women in need and my desire to start one in the Charm City has now come to fruition. Join me January 16, 2016 for our first meetup scheduled alongside our one year anniversary! Look for our next meetup coming to D.C and VA - keeping my promise to establish meetups in the DMV area. Please share. We need your support!!

Who We Are: <br>

We are a group of black women coming together to support, empower and fellowship while moving forward. We will meet to share, have fun, cry, laugh and grow. We will have various events and empowerment meetings and sharing sessions. Each Villager must make a vow upon joining. It's simple, you must vow to help at least one Villager in some form or fashion while a member of the group. This could be by way of encouraging, mentoring, praying or any way you feel that inspires or brings a smile on the face of another. This group's mission is to enjoy life and each other while having fun while moving forward. *This Meetup is an extension of the Charlotte (NC) Black Women Widows Moving Forward Meetup and The Strong Black Women Grieve Blog and Facebook communities below:

www.StrongBlackWomenGrieve.com

https://www.facebook.com/strongblackwomengrieve/

https://www.facebook.com/Blackwomenwidowsempowered/

LET'S MOVE FORWARD!

We will start with in-depth exploration of Natal Astrology, which is the Astrology of birth charts, set for the time, date and place of birth of the person moving forward to learn about its more advanced concepts and methods. This group is created to bring everyone interested in Astrology together to share knowledge and information on the subject. This is a great opportunity for anyone - from basic to advanced level - who is interested to learn more about our profound connection to the Universe.

results.description:
Financial Freedom Mastermind Group Facilitator: Nicole Bryan Services: Facilitation, training, consulting and coaching 

"You're the average of the five people you spend the most time with..." - Jim Rohn 

Benefits of the Financial Freedom Mastermind 

Build relationships, network and learn from highly motivated like-minded individuals who share similar values and drive towards financial freedom and who will hold themselves and each member of the goal accountable for achieving their goals 

Benefit from various backgrounds and expertise from various members of the group, including facilitator expertise. Receive strategies and support to help you set specific goals. 

Receive ongoing feedback on your goals and daily actions taken towards goal attainment. Gain best practices for attacking your goals and selecting high leverage daily actions towards your goals.

 Learn new ideas to accelerate progress and breakdown roadblocks towards goals 

Gain strategies for paying down debt AND expanding income (passive and active) Learn and discuss pros and cons of massive cash accumulation versus strong monthly cash flow strategy for financial freedom planning Learn best practices and share investing ideas/strategies and resources 

Gain access to tons of resources along with the network of each individual member of the group 

Enjoy the process towards financial freedom through an interactive and engaging learning process According to previous master minders, "learn more in one mastermind group in a few months, than in 4 years of college combined!" 

Facilitator Background, Related Skills and Accomplishments 

Educator/Trainer for over 15 years 

Debt free (except for mortgage debt) for over a decade 

Real Estate Agent and Home Ownership Consultant for almost a decade 

Real estate investor for over a decade Monthly Real Estate passive income stream between $2500 and $3500 dollars Owner of 16 Real Estate rental Units in over 6 different cities 

Manager of four Property Managers Knowledgeable about creative financing approaches - lines of credit, seller financing, etc 

Previous facilitator of "Superwoman" mastermind on financial literacy and goal achievement 

Podcast Guest - Epic Real Estate Investments 

Consumer of hundreds of finance books including audiobooks and podcasts; financial education junkie 

Financial Freedom Mastermind Focus Topics 

Money mindset, myths and mantras 

Goal setting 

Debt Education and Reduction Strategies 

Income Expansion Strategies (Passive and Active Income) 

Saving and Spending Analysis and Feedback Monthly spending allocation formulas 

Home Buying: Decision-Making, Planning and Execution 

Finding Your Financial Freedom Number 

Retirement Investing 101 Real Estate Investment Strategies Rich Habits and Financial Freedom Statistics $8000 in passive income per month = million dollars in the bank Financial Literacy Development Game Plan 

Mastermind Group Structure Topic: Financial Freedom Group Type: Goals and Accountability Purpose: - Develop understanding of the mindsets that impact your current level of success - Set 1 month, 3 month and 6 month financial goals - Learn high leverage strategies and best practices that will support the accomplishment of those goals Mission We are a dedicated, committed group of financial freedom fighters who are dedicated to designing our lives and living the life of our dreams. We meet on a weekly basis to set goals, get input on our goals and progress made towards goal achievement, bounce back ideas and support, learn and empower each other. We communicate daily to share daily actions that we commit to take towards our goals and to receive input and feedback on those actions from members of the group. Through our combined mind power and network we help each other to live in our purpose and reach our highest goals including our goal of financial freedom in the shortest amount of time possible. 

Norms: - Be transparent - Be vulnerable (no big egos!) - Never miss twice - Encourage, support and advise each other, ensuring that everyone has equal voice - Enjoy the journey Non-Negotiable (s) - Keep it positive! (No gossiping, complaining, etc) - Attend all meetings. If you miss a meeting you will need to do 10 burpees at the next meeting - If you are late to a meeting you will have to do 5 burpees - If a member misses twice in a row, they are eligible for dismissal from the group - If new members would like to join the group, they can only join at the end of each 4 week cycle, at the end of each round of reflections - Information shared is confidential and should remain within the group, as such participants are required to sign a non-disclosure agreement 

Group size: No more than seven or eight Ideal member: - Disciplined and committed - Highly self motivated - Believes strongly in self improvement and personal development - Reader and action taker - Honest/High level of integrity/Trustworthy/Respectful - Solid/strong income but: - still needs support figuring out how debt pay down and usage strategies - needs ideas for how to figure out how to save effectively - needs knowledge, support and/or accountability to set/meet investment goals - Intermediate level of financial expertise 

Meeting Medium: Internet (most likely google-hangout for weekly meetings); Facebook group for daily check-ins and close outs 

Goal Start Date: December 1st Membership Fee: $70/month Commitment: 

At least three months Receive at Least Three Complimentary Books with Membership - Rich Dad Poor Dad - Think and Grow Rich - Choose Yourself Guide to Wealth Superwoman Mastermind 


Testimonials "You have more tools than you know even from some of the best ppl in my Tony Robbins grad group! EVEN MY TONY ROBBINS PERSONAL COACH. BUT DO YOU REEEEEAALLY KNOW how stinkin good you are with coaching and results! It blows my mind!!!" - Tiffany Pierce 

"You know how to lead and inspire people to bring out their best. That is an incredible quality of a true visionary. You hold people accountable but still manage to encourage people around you to fulfill their potential through empathy and support." - Barbara Arroyo 

"You have such a strong ability and desire to learn but also to share your knowledge with others. You are passionate, caring and strong willed. You are also trustworthy a great listener and you give some damn good advice." - Rachel Anderson

results.description:
The mission, vision and purpose of The Women's Financial Literacy Roundtable is to help women, from all walks of life, understand personal and business finance in order to secure their financial futures.

Over 53% of households have a female breadwinner and in most households, women are the primary money managers. Conversely, women are more likely to not have a complete understanding of finances (both personal and business), are less likely to have access to collateral and are more likely to find themselves without easy and quick access to capital.

At The Women's Financial Literacy Roundtable (TWFLR), we have a simple mantra:
Plan. Prepare. Protect. Prosper.


TWFLR will offer timely, relevant information, articles, workshops and other events from financial experts to empower and equip women with the resources to:

• manage debt

• establish and maintain your creditworthiness

• protect your income and assets

• determine and increase your net worth

• develop a solid financial plan (and stick with it!)

• plan for college and retirement

• create and manage wealth

• plan your estate and leave a legacy for your family (and much more!)


 "Women should take an ACTIVE interest in their financial situation and participate in financial decision-making..." www.financialobserver.com
results.name: Women's Financial Literacy Roundtable

results.description:
"FRIENDS HELPING FRIENDS MAKE BUSINESS CONNECTIONS" - J.Z.


Calling all Entrepreneurs, Business Owners and those who dream of running their own venture!


If you desire to expand your business network, make more friends, find new customers and become a leader in your community, we have a fun and informal social networking group that is just right for you.


We'll have monthly meetings at coffee shops or neighbourhood bars in and around town to connect with others & learn "best practice" sales, marketing, finance and time management tactics and strategies from your city’s top entrepreneurs.


The Smart Success Business Network is a community run by volunteers with 101 Meetup groups in 101 cities across Australia, Canada, New Zealand, the United Kingdom and United States. 


MOST EVENTS ARE FREE AND ALL BUSINESS OWNERS & MANAGERS ARE WELCOME.

• No attendance commitment required.
• You can arrive and leave on your schedule.
• No elevator pitches in front of the group required.
• Informal bar/restaurant meetings in the evenings.
• Most meetups are between Tuesdays & Thursdays.
• No long sit down meals next to strangers. 

Our mission is to encourage business success by recruiting small business owners to give group talks to their peers, potential customers and suppliers and new entrepreneurs to share their expertise and offer words of support and encouragement to their community.


 We are also known as a "Pay it Forward" group. You might find your ideal client/customer here in your first meetup but it's more likely you will meet someone who can benefit from goods & services offered by your friends.

By networking to help other business owners and recommending products or services by other members, the benefits of increased sales accumulate to everyone in the group.


Benefits of networking with us:


You will learn how to avoid unprofitable markets, attract the right customers, block negative critical thinking, be both effective and efficient, understand cash flow and much more.


Though powerful stories and proven strategies, you will learn how to boldly harness your creative force, break free of fear and get your life and business aligned with your values and the market's needs.


With the right knowledge and support, you can design a life and business that embodies strength and boldness that you know you are capable of. See you at one of our meetings soon.
results.name: Smart Success Business Network of Baltimore

results.description:
Hope Springs Community Church is a non-denominational church located in Severna Park, MD. The core values of HSCC are Love, Acceptance, Compassion, Inclusivity, and the desire for all believers to experience the GOOD NEWS of a Transforming Relationship with Jesus Christ. We believe that the Love of Christ can make a difference in our community and in our world. We want to Love God and Love Others. 

Whether you're new to a church experience; you're fed up with organized religion; or you just have questions and want to talk freely and openly, then we are the church for you.  Everyone is welcome!

Please join us.
results.name: Hope Springs Community Church

results.description: "I want to feel something, as a person. I don't want to be bored." - Pina Bausch We are a group of people interested in contemporary dance and performance art. We are looking for non-mainstream shows in the DMV area. We are looking for intriguing rather than entertaining... Let's meet up!
results.name: Dance, Dance, Dance DMV
